snippet: An article on Thursday about Republicans who spoke before a national Hispanic organization misstated the number of the California proposition in June that called for abolishing bilingual education. It was 227. (Proposition 187 was a 1994 initiativ...
lead_paragraph: An article on Thursday about Republicans who spoke before a national Hispanic organization misstated the number of the California proposition in June that called for abolishing bilingual education. It was 227. (Proposition 187 was a 1994 initiative to deny state services to illegal immigrants.)
abstract: Correction of July 2 article misstated number of California proposition that called for abolishing bilingual education ; it was was Proposition 227, not 187
section_name: Education; Corrections; New York and Region
